results.title: Proud 2 Be Me!
results.creator_credit: Hannah Petrowski, Leah Felsbourg, Chloe McKenna, Charlotte Kinsella, Jessica Smith, Amy Rowe and Isabelle Tonna
results.brief_description:
A story of a little, white monster who feels like he doesn’t belong. He tries to make himself fit in, which doesn’t quite work out. The other little monsters finally decide that they like the little white monster just the way he is.

Under the category ‘Bullying. No Way! - Primary’, Years 5 and 6, St Luke’s Primary School, Victoria, were the Screen It 2012 winners.

results.title: Protozoa: one-celled animals
results.brief_description: Dr Roman Vishniac, scientist and microphotographer, identifies pseudopods, flagelettes, and ciliates, showing how they move, eat and reproduce. Provides examples of symbiosis, parasitism, and colonial organisations.

results.title: Protist reproduction (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Biomedia Associates and Bruce J. Russell
results.brief_description: Shows a sexual reproductive methods of protists, including fission, with replication of organelles and subcellular particles, specialised forms of budding (in suctorians) conjugation in ciliates and algae and the production of eggs and sperm by colonial protists.

results.title: Protist physiology (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Inhabitants of the Planet Earth”.
Examines the internal processes of independently living cells, including mechanisms for phagocytosis and digestion, and for saprozoic and autotrophic nutrition. Describes symbiotic associations between autotrophs and heterotrophs and methods of water balance.

results.title: Protist ecology (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Inhabitants of the Planet Earth”.
Discusses the vital role played by protists in the ecology of the planet Earth. Examines the commensal, parasitic, and mutualistic life styles practiced by a large number of protist species.

results.title: Protist behaviour (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Shows avoidance reactions, mechanisms for aggregation in favorable environemtns, predator-prey relationships, light reactions, and escape responses in free-living protists.

results.title: Protests following the shooting of Keith Lamont Scott in Charlotte
results.brief_description: BlackLivesMatter started appearing online after a white man was acquitted of killing unarmed black teenager Trayvon Martin in 2012. It has since evolved beyond a hashtag to become a worldwide movement used to unite activists and hold authorities to account.
